Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2010 06:28AM seaotter wrote: I don't know the answer but I do know if you have any removed you are at risk for lymphedema. Do your research on it and protect that arm. A lot of doctors do not tell you about the risk. There is a lot of information on these boards about it. Patty
Posts.Title: don't get the whole "nodes" protocol slcst12 otter

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 12:37AM seaotter wrote: Well I'm sorry but it was vanity for me when I would get a suntan. I have had quite a few skin cancers removed because of the sun. So I wish you the best with that. Maybe you should discuss it with your doctor.
Posts.Title: Tanning after Radiation Jeanne_D Jeanne_D

Posts.Content: seaotter wrote: Hi all. I will be starting rads in June. I wasn't going to do them at all. My surgeon convinced me I should. I told him I have been reading where 3 weeks of rads are just as good as 6 weeks. He told me that the James Care in Columbus, Ohio (which is where I go) is doing a study on the 3 weeks thing and he is all for it. I finally won one!!!!!! So girls talk to your doctor maybe it will be doable for you as well. We certainly will not have to suffer as long! I have said no to tam and als. God Bless us all !! Dx 1/22/2009, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 1/30 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
